website_summaries.verdict: Waterproof and breathable, Moov Now tracks active minutes and sleep, and features advanced features especially designed for swimmers.
pros: Gives you real-time audio coaching for running, cycling, cardio boxing and body weight
Advanced swim tracker analyzes stroke type and count and laps
Battery life up to six months
Great for swimming, even in smaller, home pools
cons: The tracking disc inside the device can fall out when you take the tracker off

customer_reviews.title: Love this fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.text: The long and short is that Moov does a better job at promoting and tracking your progress in your training than others but doesn't offer immediate data without syncing it to your phone. This tracker puts more attention on your personal achievement rather than spitting out data constantly. If you're looking for a good entry-level fitness tracker, this is the perfect one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Moov is a home run!
customer_reviews.text: Just got a Moov and have worn it for a week... I love it... I have had other fitness trackers but nothing like this... having the coaching/workout options already programed at your fingertips is not only amazing but I can't believe the motivation it's given me to workout already and to do it in a way that is healthy and safe for me... I am at 284#'s and hope to give another update with an improvement... way to go Moov team! You hit this one out of the park!
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn F.

customer_reviews.title: Great coaching and motivation!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the coaching on this, especially for walking/running and cycling. Competing against myself to move up the levels is very motivating. I wish it could also do indoor cycling, but the outdoor functions are great. I like that it logs sleep and shows you the proportion of type of sleep. Sometimes it doesn't track active minutes when I'm hiking, but it would be great if it did. Overall, I'm happy with Moov.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Product dead after 8 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is not reliable, dead in 8 months of use. Not a battery issue. Even after changing to new battery, the app didn't record any data and won't sync. While using dropped bluetooth connections a lot and didn't get data recorded many times. Non existing customer service. Get garmin or apple watch for swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Jiyoun Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great, for a few days. Then useless.
customer_reviews.text: Had I reviewed this in the first few days after I received it I likely would have given it 3-4 stars. It worked okay, although only counted active minutes which I wasn’t aware of previously. I was hoping for for steps or something like that. But it still worked okay, however after tracking eight days in a row, it completely quit working. I thought maybe there was a battery issue so I tried replacing it which did nothing. So basically I paid for eight days of tracking and now I have a worthless bracelet. Yay. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: clppppppp

customer_reviews.title: I know it was on properly because he has worn it for months- the strap/closure could be better designed to stay on more securely
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend - he likes it and wears it all the time, mostly for the biking and sleep tracking. However, the strap came undone, (the closure popped out) and fell off (he couldn't find it) so I got him another one. This just happened again where it fell off and was lost. I know it was on properly because he has worn it for months- the strap/closure could be better designed to stay on more securely than just a little plastic knob that pops into one of the holes - I do like the overall design, but this is the issue that he has had.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie B.

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF !!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for swimming laps. After the first swim, the device was dead. Put in new battery...still dead. I contacted MOOV and explained that the device was faulty. They said that they don’t guarantee “drowned devices!” They also suggested that I should buy a replacement for $60 at a one time 30% discount. Really? Why would I want a device that wasn’t waterproof? I have not heard any further response. There is no phone number to call. Don’t waste your money. This device is garbage and the company won’t stand by their “100% guarantee”.
customer_reviews.author: Miss J

customer_reviews.title: I got this as a gift–and I've loved it since the second I opened it up
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift–and I've loved it since the second I opened it up! Not only is it sleek looking (I got the pink band) and super durable, but the programs really work. They're intuitive, they hook up to Apple Health and other apps without any trouble, and they're easy to personalize whether you're working on short- or long-term fitness goals. (Bonus: the sleep tracker has helped me understand and optimize my daily routine more than anything else I've tried.) The Moov Now is just plain great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: helps me stay active
customer_reviews.text: i DID have to pair it with Google Fit THEN pair it with MYFITNESS Pal as it doesn't pair on its on with that app. You DO have to open the app and press the device to upload to your app but it's not really that big of a deal. it IS waterproof! I never take mine off. I also switched to wearing it on my ankle to get a more accurate step count which it's not EXTREMELY accurate but i'm using it more as a motivation tool.
customer_reviews.author: JENN

customer_reviews.title: Get into the Moov
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Moov primarily for swimming and tracking my progress. Blown away by the amount of data it provides, and the ease of use. Sometimes it takes awhile to sync and pull all the data, but it's easy to use with the app, and great analytics. I don't use it for the coaching, voice commands, but for data it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tomasetti

customer_reviews.title: perfect for swimming
customer_reviews.text: I for one am one of those people hate to have a bulky watch on my wrist. I only want to know my swimming stats. for that purpose, this is perfect. it has surprisingly detailed stats down to every lap, swolf, swimming time, turn time, etc etc. and it's so small, no need to worry about charge it up either. to me it's perfect. My only issue is that it doesn't connect with Huawei p30. Fortunately I have an iPhone 7plus sitting in my drawer. the iPhone app is perfect. just toss it in the locker before working out, sync when done, then all your stats are there.
customer_reviews.author: Alhambra Dude

customer_reviews.title: Great for coaching!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my Moov now for the coaching-related aspects. I do not use it as my everyday tracker (Google Fit takes care of that), but it's wonderful for working out, especially for people who don't like a lot of group classes but want to learn proper techniques. Plus, it tracks my swimming laps, even knows what type of stroke I did on each lap.
customer_reviews.author: Syina

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 swims
customer_reviews.text: Two swimmers on our team each got one of these for Christmas this year and both bands broke already, one during the first swim practice and the other during the second practice. There is a small square piece that just flies off and gets lost in the pool. Then you can't even wear the thing. Besides that, the tracker is not accurate AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Krista M. Bevan

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth issue can be very frustrating at times
customer_reviews.text: There is no count of steps, so if you need a count you need to carry an extra pedometer. I'm glad it finally connects to Google Fit, and the workouts they've added to the app seem great. The Bluetooth connection on this thing can be a hit or miss when you have this device around the ankle for running. I've tried it with at least four different phones, and on some days, it can be a frustrating experience. Unlike other reviewers here, the swimming tracking seemed to work well (usually free-style). I'd given it 5 if it had included a better performing Bluetooth transmitter inside, and actually gave you a number for the steps.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Han

customer_reviews.title: Great for Swimming Workouts!
customer_reviews.text: Works great in the pool, however it does not always calculate breast stroke and fly properly. I can't wait for them to allow 2 moov now's for swimming like they do for other sports so that it can calculate just kicking. we do a fair amount of just kicking in the water. But i am still glad i got it;it seems to be fairly accurate and it gives a lot of helpful analyses
customer_reviews.author: pckrfan

customer_reviews.title: Total failure to record non-app workouts (cycling and swimming)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for swimming based on reviews. Half an hour of swimming (for testing), approximately 1300 - 1400 meters in total (25 meters indoor pool). Failed to sync back. App said "Syncing swim" or something like that, and then, nothing. Same deal with cycling. Wore this thing on my ankle (as suggested), went for half an hour test ride. Failed to sync back. No activities recorded. Two for two. Totally useless. In app workouts sort of work but phone has to be near by.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My husband swims regularly and bought this product to monitor and improve his swimming performance. At first he was satisfied but about two weeks after using the watch the battery ran out and he didn't have a replacement battery. The app gave the "battery low" indication but at the same time the watch wasn't able to keep recording the day's exercise. Also, in one of the swim sessions it recorded only six laps while the whole session included 60 laps. There is no summary of all exercises together to show a trend or a way to improve. Feels like it's just a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Dali

customer_reviews.title: I use it only for swimming in a 25 meters pool
customer_reviews.text: I can say after 6 months of using it, I am ready for giving a review. It measures the laps pretty accurate. Only drawback would be that it relies on your arm for measuring laps, so if you are doing only kicks exercises it would "think" you are resting. If you spend your whole time just doing crol (or any other style/exercise where you use your arms) it will measure 99% perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Castillo Chavarria

customer_reviews.title: Who needs steps!?
customer_reviews.text: I am just getting use to Moov and the learning curve is challenging, but I love this experience of tracking my activity. While I wasn't able to take my brisk walk today I still managed to warm up and remain relatively active today. Who knew I could burn so many calories grocery shopping. Wonder a bit about sleep. Only 30% restorative sleep. Thought I would have more. Do senior adults need less restorative sleep? Good news my wiener dog Lucy needs to loose 2 lbs, she's on a diet... our walks are helping her. Right now it's cold in Cali. Can't wait to track my swims. Now get to dancing!
customer_reviews.author: Cfs

customer_reviews.title: My fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Simple little comfortable tracker. I got it primarily because it works when swimming. The swimming workout feature works great. I don't like that it doesn't track running from my wrist and the app has to be open and active when running for the workout feature to work. The app also didn't sync with anything other then Apple at first which means I had to copy data to other health apps I use. It now syncs with some other stuff now so it's slightly better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Taborski

customer_reviews.title: Buyer’s remorse
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work on an elliptical, which was info buried in their website that I didn’t find until after purchase. I bought it to wear on my ankle due to work issues, and it’s awful at counting steps, never registered more than 1200 steps in a day. It only ever recorded “activity” when I was at the gym because it thinks I sleep +12 hours a day. Finally, it fell out of the band at some point while the band stayed tightly strapped to my ankle, so a real waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Icee54

customer_reviews.title: Moov Now is a cheap device.  unstable connectivity with Iphone
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The Moov Now 3D Fitness Tracker & Real Time Audio Coach is difficult to use. It would connect sometimes, and other times it would not connect at all . Tried it for a few days and gave up. Great concept , terrible product . Returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Tonda Dysart

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! I chose this fitness tracker over other more popular ones because I swim on a local masters team and participate in a few open water races per year. This one tracks your practices and laps and is fairly accurate (I have yet to find one that picks up on kicking sets). My job is active so I wanted to track my activity level to balance out my calorie intake. Only reason I did not give 5 stars is the wrist band will stretch and have to be replaced at some point. Again, GREAT product at this price point! Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wryk

customer_reviews.title: Swim data sync problem solved
customer_reviews.text: iPhone users experiencing swim data sync problems: background app refresh must be “active” to enable iPhone to accept sync swim data from 3D Fitness Tracker. (Settings -> General -> Background App Refresh -> Background App Refresh - select Wi-Fi or WiFi & Cellular Data - then scroll to Moov Coach and select “on” - shows green). This applies to iPhone 6 Plus running iOS 12.1.4. Yours may differ. Moov systems works very well; captured all 30 minutes of swim and details for all 60 “laps.” Now I understand why a “lap” in Moov is one length of pool. Also, sleep data compare favorably with CPAP device. Very happy with performance and value.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: No support from manufacturer or Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty disappointed w/ my purchase. I bought the device end of Jan and it broke after three weeks. The battery was drained pretty quickly and After replacement the device only worked for two more days. Tried Amazon support which directed me to manufacturer support. Manufacturer asked me to update firmware which was already done before use. Got no more info from manufacturer and Amazon said they would follow up. This made me question my prime membership and the way Amazon handle things w/ suppliers that are not responsive. Be aware that if you buy and have a problem you won’t get any support. Wish I could give zero stars :(
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius Gaspar

customer_reviews.title: Great for spinning
customer_reviews.text: I have a small ankle so the smaller band works fine for me. The longer bracelet could accommodate a fairly large ankle but not sure of exact size. It was simple to set up out of the box. I downloaded the app and paired the device. When I spin, I just press on the device, open the app, choose "indoor cycling", "start workout", then touch the circle next to "moov" and it's on. I compared the cadence to a bike with a cadence counter and it was spot on!
customer_reviews.author: spowers

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: device downloaded firmware update literally 3 minutes out of the package and no longer functions. Followed all troubleshooting prompts and even changed battery. It never paired and just kept me on the landing screen. I checked the power light and it was off. Unfortunately no matter what I did itbNever turned back on. What a waste of money. Submitted a ticket to moov but they are closed on weekends for customer service. I'm not waiting 3 days for them to tell me to send it back. Thankful for amazon's return policy with defective crap like this.
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this for swimming and is very accurate. I also want to note that if you get it wet on the inside, it's alright, I accidentally left it on my wrist while going down 12 feet and totally forgot, a few days later it stopped working so I opened it up and there was water droplets everywhere, I simply took a smooth cloth like the ones for phone screens and rubbed it around to soak up the droplets. Next thing was the battery and it was wet so all I did was got a new one, placed it in the moov now, and it worked just as new.
customer_reviews.author: JermJerm

customer_reviews.title: Unsuccessful at swim tracking
customer_reviews.text: I got this just before the pandemic hit. I used a few times in December and January with no issues. No use in April to June. Had to replace battery in July when I could use again but that wasn't an issue as a second battery was in the box. The issue is after 2 long swims where the app started to record, upon trying to end the session which wasn't over 2 hours, the app was no longer connected. I'm using it in a different facility and the distance between phone and tracker might be greater. Still extremely disappointed a fitness tracker I purchased to track my swim progress doesn't in fact track the results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had my moov now band for almost a month. I train with it 4 days a week. I am currently getting back into shape after an illness. So far, I am seeing muscles & definition again. It urges me to advance to the next level. It has so many different programs to do, as well as different levels. I'm looking forward to trying some more of the programs.
customer_reviews.author: nurseynurse88

customer_reviews.title: Small problem with first sync, then a great product with zero problems.
customer_reviews.text: My Moov fits around my wrist pretty comfortably and I sometimes completely forget it's there. The mobile app is pretty functional and receives updates periodically. I did have a pretty hard time with it right out of the box. I could not get it to sync to my phone at all and was going to give up on it until I found the solution in another review. I opened the Moov disk with the provided tool, pulled out and and put back the battery, and then the Moov worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio in TX

customer_reviews.title: Awesome exercise companion.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome non-intrusive device! No need to look at a display throughout the day. Paired with the app, the coaching and stats are perfect. I like that you can level up or down and still get a good workout. The workouts are great to do in hotels when traveling or at the gym or outdoors. I even wear it on my ankle when playing soccer ;). I haven't worn a watch in ages, so I was concern about having something strapped on my wrist. The soft band does not get in the way when I am at the computer... barely notice that I am wear it. Not having to charge another device daily, is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Edward King

customer_reviews.title: MOOV
customer_reviews.text: Use it everyday and I don't take it off, I use it for biking, jogging and swimming. I order a second one, but there's not enough stuff to use two of them yet. MOOV does not have a desktop version like FItbit, but it has a nice app for your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: One of the best fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I have it for just three weeks, but I love it. The battery that remains for months, it is really amazing. I miss feed tracking and a weight chart or other information like fat percentage that can be entered to help better define objects and workouts. I hope it will comes in future versions of the app. The bracelet is discreet and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Cezar Martins

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are individuals who would like this band, but not me. It only tracks steps when you are doing a workout, and no other time. I'm not sure of it's overall goal except to be used only when and only when you are at the gym. If you want to track your steps, heart beat and calories, this is not the band for you.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: This is by far my favorite fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite fitness tracker. It may not due steps or heart rate but it calculates active moments. I swim and spin quite a bit and this tracks those activities. The sad part is I lost it at work last week. I am a nurse and while at work the band loosened and fell off while removing contact gowns. I like that the MOOV tracker is not bulky. I wished it had a sturder latch.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Messer

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Great!!! I've had MOOV for just over a week and it just seems to get better and better. I originally got it because I started swimming and wanted to be able to track it. The MOOV is perfect! The stats are super helpful and informative. The boxing 'game' is fun to the point where it doesn't feel like exercise. Think of Rockband or Just Dance, without the stellar music. The only downside is you have to upload the data from the MOOV to the app, but it's fast! 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable way to get all swim details I was looking for. Only con is slow sync with App.
customer_reviews.text: Affordable way to get the swimming details I was looking for! Keeps track of lap counts, pauses between laps, kind of strokes, number of strokes per lap, length per stroke etc... Only con is the long time (almost 2 minutes) to sync the Moov with the app on the phone. Seems there isn't that much data to sync, so why is that taking that long? Would imagine they should be able to trim that down to seconds, in which case the experience would be even better ...
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: Does the company provide the real app for Android?
customer_reviews.text: I received the item two days ago and it seems good. However, I have failed to download the proper application (Moov Coach) from Google Play. The customer service just replied me with the address of the app which is not working at all. I wonder if the company keeps maintaining the app... It doesn't have the display, so without the app it is totally useless!!! Please check before you purchase the item. So disappointing experience so far.
customer_reviews.author: Soeun Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth synching is not intuitive have to try few more times if its done have to scroll down every time to check the time..Just miss the vibration if sitting idle like other fitness trackers..The strap locking is very painful have to try too many times to lock..really need smooth locking..Rest all is ok need also a detailed hourly history.
customer_reviews.author: Irfan Syed

customer_reviews.title: Push your limits in brisk walking and lose weight intelligently
customer_reviews.text: This little device made a real difference in my daily brisk walking! I've pushed my limits and reached speeds that would have seemed fictional just 2 months ago. Having the coach in my ear, monitoring each step and letting me know as soon as I slow down or land too hard on my leg, along with the detailed statistics - great stuff! Only thing I was missing was linking the data to other apps, or being able to set weight/cadence goals in the app, and monitor my progress toward said goals.
customer_reviews.author: Barak Danin

customer_reviews.title: Although it’s a good tracking thing ( it’s not a watch) by its ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, Although it’s a good tracking thing ( it’s not a watch) by its price, I still didn’t feel comfortable with it. Because Its app isn’t flexible, people have to follow exactly their instructions or it won’t work. That’s make me angry sometimes. In conclusion, it still a good thing to buy. Just need some improvement
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my son - collegiate water polo player
customer_reviews.text: My son is a collegiate water polo player. He loves it! He finds it to be accurate in counting his effort while swimming and conditioning. He does not wear it in scrimmages. The team also does extensive dry-land exercising and there he takes advantage of the coaching features. He still uses an iPhone 6s and finds the app to be stable, informative and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tracker!
customer_reviews.text: I love the MOOV tracker. I especially like the indoor bike feature. You can wear the tracker on your ankle to track your biking time and cadence. You can use it with the MyFitnessPal calorie tracker so you can keep track of calories you burn. It's comfortable and you don't have to charge it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel W.

customer_reviews.title: Not what it says it is
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work like it was supposed to but it did not. It never would sync with my gps on my phone, it constantly told me it had lost signal with the heart rate monitor even on workouts that said it didn't need one. Since it never found the gps signal, it never coached me as it said it would. It was super comfortable to wear and less intrusive than a fitbit. But that's about it. No customer service to get in touch with, so it's been returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is very good for recognizing strokes and counting laps
customer_reviews.text: I use this for swimming. It is very good for recognizing strokes and counting laps, but fails to recognize most training techniques, like kicking, and counts it as resting time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Good device for swimming! Several interesting stats to track your progress
customer_reviews.text: Checked the device just in swimming. So can say it works pretty fine. The only thing was once when it took literally 4 breast strokes for an entire lap. That was strange. For the rest - it's fine: possibility to observe several params of swimming to get the idea of progress - that's enough for me. It doesn't fit as step counter - just shows the time of your activity, no matter you ran or just walked or just moved your arm with a tracker on it. I want to check it on my bicycle as well to get the idea of how it works for cycling. Now I'm pretty satisfied with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for working out, but battery life of device is nowhere near as long as claimed
customer_reviews.text: I love that this device is strictly about fitness and its accuracy is quite good. For cycling, it provides accurate distance, speed, and cadence information. My only complaint is that the battery does not last nearly as long as claimed. Rather than one battery lasting six months, I am finding that one battery barely lasts a month. Not counting the battery that came with the device, I have already gone through 3 brand new batteries and am currently on my fourth.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Company--Will Not Disappoint
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and company. They stand behind everything they do and sell! Great apps, easy to use, and much, much better than the tiny screens and limited functionality of other products. Coaching is great, products work seamless with the downloadable workouts and your phone. Will never own anything else! Highly recommend for serious workout enthusiasts and athletes.
customer_reviews.author: NJNomad

customer_reviews.title: Useful tracker, may need to replace band or unit after a year or two due to cracking
customer_reviews.text: So I've owned this for nearly two years now, and have "enjoyed" the tracker and all that it can do for me. I do believe that this has helped me maintain a better fitness level. My only complaint is the durability of the device is now showing. The band is starting to split in some areas that hold the tracker in place. The tracker itself is developing a crack in from where it gets pressed to sync and update. Good device, just would prefer it not start falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: johns550

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 months then it quit working!
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my daughter, it worked great for 2 months. She is a competitive swimmer and loved using it to track her workouts. After 2 months it quit working and we are just barely out of the product support window! It may be the battery, but that's really sad that the battery only works for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: D. Blood

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is elegantly simple, but provides robust metrics on your physical performance. The feature that is not desirable is the 2 hour recording limit set for swimming. I swim longer than 2 hours, but the device stops at that limit. The time feauture should be removed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor design and no customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who plays High School and Club Volleball. Liked the idea of being able to wear it on the ankle. DO NOT BUY!! It wouldn’t work with the battery sent so we bought a new battery. Changing the battery is EXTREMELY DIFFICULT! With the new battery it lasted one day and quit. Poor design. We unfortunately missed the Amazon return date and the company is based in India. The toll free customer service Number on the MOV website does not work, so don’t expect help in anyway if you want or need it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Day

customer_reviews.title: No daily step tracking, some difficulty syncing
customer_reviews.text: Does not actually track your daily steps, but instead specific activity steps, this is not apparent based on most reviews I had read. Syncing can also be like pulling teeth. For those with trouble syncing: Go to sync your device in the app, which will force your blue tooth on. Switch screens out of the app and turn blue tooth off. Then press the device and switch back to the app on your phone. Worked every time but I had to do that every time instead of it just syncing in the app.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: for lack of a better word. Doctor read me the riot act and ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 45 yo man. Athletic when i was younger. Sedentary for at least a decade. I lost 70lbs by starving myself, for lack of a better word. Doctor read me the riot act and i started eating healthy and exercising. Ive used a moov now since october 2017. I use it to brisk walk an hour, the seven minute workout, and 10 mins of cardio boxing every day. An hour twenty minutes a day. I've been around 180lbs since october. The fat is still coming off, but muscle is building. Step counters are useless. This thing tracks only moderate to intense activity; the activity that matters. This little thing is helping to change my life.
customer_reviews.author: tfdIV

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, battery did seem do die a little sooner than expected. The default band that comes with it is horrible to take on and off. I got an after market band to make it easier. I do love the product. Make sure you retain the clip to open the battery compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Rhett Hymas

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for activity monitoring.
customer_reviews.text: Thin. Fits under my sleeve without fraying my shirt edge. Very comfortable. It’s not a watch, but I wasn’t expecting one. App has a few places where it is not intuitive, but it’s good enough. Battery was low and died within a day. 4 stars for that. Extremely simple device that’s very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schwabe

customer_reviews.title: It is not a heart rate tracker
customer_reviews.text: I am not quite sure about the results, but is undeniable that I expected a lot more. It could messure your heart rate, for example. And track your work by gps. But no, the product only check your activity and give you some advice.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer service
customer_reviews.text: Mainly used for tracking swimming activities. This device meet minimal expectations of tracking swim time and laps but technical parameters are not accurate. Worst thing is they do not have meaningful customer support. You can only send emails if you have a issue with your device or app, and after collecting all information you provide they will tell you please leave a feedback on their website, and then close the case. Do not buy Moov if you can’t bear with this!
customer_reviews.author: jy18

customer_reviews.title: I would prefer it to have a regular watch wristband ...
customer_reviews.text: I would prefer it to have a regular watch wristband attachment. I've had the attachment come loose a few times, sometimes because the buttons weren't pushed through completely, sometimes from just catching on something. It is waterPROOF, which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: DRJ

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive High Quality Activity Tracker
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, high-quality activity tracker with a bonus. I'm giving Moov Now a bonus because it actually provides realtime feedback that helped me improve my running form...I call it the Moov Now voodoo! I just need to find the best HRM to pair with it. The app can be a little confusing at first but it's easy enough to figure out with repeat usage. You just can't beat the $60 price tag when you consider the quality and features.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Gambrell

customer_reviews.title: Valuable feedback on my technique and useful ideas have help me improve each day
customer_reviews.text: This is more than just a fitness tracker!! I have used three other fitness trackers and this is the first time I have felt engaged and driven. This tracker is also a must if you swim. Valuable feedback on my technique and useful ideas have help me improve each day. And it's one of the few that records swimming as exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Sarah Gunnels Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness tracker that works smoothly
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of Moov devices and have used them extensively doing cardio boxing workouts. I am impressed by the accuracy to track all my punches (speed, altitude, strength, etc) getting a nice summary in the Moov application at the end of each workout. Calories and time of exercise are automatically uploaded to the Apple Health App and from there to my MyFitnessPal App.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a step tracker!
customer_reviews.text: How can a fitness tracker not track steps?! This should be in bold print in the item description. It says it can be used for walk and run. Very disappointed. I’m going to request a return although I already through out the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: The band does not stay secure, and it does not count steps automatically
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product, but after a few days of use, it was not registering activity. it appears you have to manually start the app to get tracking movement which is very inconvenient. If this is not the case, then the app is not user friendly. Secondly, 2 weeks of use and the band fell of my ankle to my dismay while I was running around, it has never been located, despite many attempts to locate and retrace my steps.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D Carmon

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me, I thought it would track when I’m up and moving. Seems to only track long periods on your feet. Due to back issues that not possible for me. I did like the light weight and comfort it provided, I think this was designed for a more active person.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Kaestner

customer_reviews.title: It stop working
customer_reviews.text: I use it for running and swimming, not very accurate but for the price i think that it was very good for swimming. It struggle with the connection during running. Before being able to test it for cycling it stops working... unable to turn it on so i return it...
customer_reviews.author: HZ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! So far using this for swimming
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! So far using this for swimming. Love house it keeps track of type of stroke, laps, time spent, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 8 times swimming
customer_reviews.text: I actually liked it a lot until today. I wanted to turn it on and it was dead. Not sure if the battery is empty or if it is broken. Last time, it showed that the battery is still good. I have it now for about 2 or 3 weeks and I used it 8 times for swimming and one time for cycling and it is already gone. I want to like it but the battery life/durability is just not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hüttner

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The sensor is alright for tracking runs and bike rides. I wanted this to primarily track strokes , distance, laps and pace while swimming in a pool. I find the results to be far from accurate for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Livefreeordye

customer_reviews.title: this is NOT a fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a fitness tracker which I could use in my water aerobics class because other ones which say that are waterproof, are not. It is waterproof but there is no screen for you to keep track of steps and other features. It all operates off your phone and the app is not very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Battery problem!!!
customer_reviews.text: Battery was out !!! For Just One day!!! I was confused... It was Out of order!! So, I was plan to refund,,, anyway, I was wondering,,,, maybe battery problem???!!! so, I replaced the battery, and it works!!! fortunately, I'm not going to refund!!! The product is light, comfortable, and suitable for swimming!!! please care for battery!!! thanks anyway!!! Have a wonderful day for everyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: User of "Moov Now"!!!

customer_reviews.title: Great device and app.
customer_reviews.text: Got the moov band for Xmas and have lost 10 pounds in 2 months. Is easy to use and watching the daily activity level is great motivation. Last night I was 7 minutes short of 2 hours so I just had to fold some laundry to get over the mark. My wife loved it. 😏
customer_reviews.author: Evan G Fisher

customer_reviews.title: This tracker is amazing! A lot of really cool technology
customer_reviews.text: This tracker is amazing! A lot of really cool technology. It's helping me train for a triathlon. Excellent tracker for the price. I supplemented it with the heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: AgentRusco

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use in water - no response fro Moov to get replaced
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a few of these a really like them. They track swimming, biking and running really well. I had one of them fail on first use - in pool swimming. The response from Moov has been really poor. So far no response on how to return for replacement . come on. failed on first use!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did only one day of swim 100% accurate so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kushan Jayasuriya

customer_reviews.title: Major Hassle
customer_reviews.text: Came with a dead battery and no extra. My first experience will be changing the battery. Terrible first impression.
customer_reviews.author: Johnebgood

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Used for 12 swims and less than a month and the battery is dead. Seal broke when trying to open to change battery. Basically worthless to me now. The bands are good. Just a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Have to have your phone with you within a certain range. Great customer service. A lot cheaper than your expensive smart watches.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Knepper

customer_reviews.title: Activity sync is complicated
customer_reviews.text: I had very high hopes for it specially when using it while swimming. It started good but for every 4-5 workouts it will miss one. When I try to sync it fails and discards the entire workout which is disappointing. I keep it on my wrist all the time but need to activate the mode every time and that’s no issue, but so far I lost 3 workouts :-(
customer_reviews.author: H. ALSHEIKH

customer_reviews.title: Too Unreliable - Doesn’t capture workout data
customer_reviews.text: This worked for great for my first 5 swims, then on the 6th, rather than downloading my workout data, I got a message that it could not recognize my workout. If this only happened every once in a while, I could live with it, but now after dozens more swims, it’s only tracking about 70% of them. Gonna have to toss it, and look for something else. I wouldn’t recommend until they can improve reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W Munsee

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! It tracks everything! I don't know how it knows which style of swimming I'm doing but it does!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Whyte

customer_reviews.title: Very Good!
customer_reviews.text: I use it mainly for swimming. It helps recording the move, the SWOLF etc. It records the time for each turn, but not very accurate. But that's acceptable, because you don't have to push a button when you start which is very convenient. The time record is just for reference. It's also a fun to use 2 Moov Now to do the boxing. I sweat a lot after 5 rounds of boxing. Strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. Continuously lose data. Can’t record anything other than sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Steelers

customer_reviews.title: Useless for swimming
customer_reviews.text: My daughter swims year round and I thought it would be cool to have a device to track how far she is swimming each day and week. This had good reviews and was way less expensive than other options, so I ordered it. It is supposed to be able to determine stroke and distance just based on the movements. After her first 1 hour 15 minute practice with it on, it said she swam 0.2 miles and the strokes were a joke. Tried it one more practice with equally inaccurate results. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm really having fun with this
customer_reviews.text: I'm really having fun with this. Still early and have used it for 8 days but. At the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: mjg

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this gadget. Its small and light so I tend to forget I'm wearing it. The product delivers its claim. I have used it to cycle on my road bike. The Moov coach keeps me updated of my time, speed, cadence, and the gear I'm in---it even displays elevation. I cant wait to use it again and try it on my next run! So much is offered for such a small price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: didn't track my movements properly and worst of all
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Moov now to track my swimming...The first one I purchased just flat out didn't work. I exchanged it for a second one, it sort of worked. Didn't track my sleep properly, didn't track my movements properly and worst of all, it failed to track my swimming...because it died in the water! It's not waterproof as stated, it's not swim proof, obviously, it's just crap...don't waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Curls

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Bought it to track activity and calories burned. More of a training tool, which was not my purpose. Bought it because it is water proof and I wanted to use it during water aerobics. But really most suitable for lap swimming. Have used it for cycling but gave up because too often it recorded nothing. Needs a more on/off definitive activation.
customer_reviews.author: Debornan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with OnePlus 5T!!
customer_reviews.text: They don't mention that anywhere on this Amazon page! I contacted them their customer support when the android app wasn't working. They replied after a couple of days and apparently their developers can't get the app to work on OnePlus5T!! They really need to hire some better engineers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Moov as an easy to easy activity tracker for my daughter. If I could rate at a 0, I would. When it works, it is fine. Most of the time, it will not connect to the app on my phone! I even purchased and installed a new battery. Nothing. And therefore is useless! It also interferes with my other Bluetooth devices. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Nowicki

customer_reviews.title: Pleased after just one swim
customer_reviews.text: After one swim I'm already in love. The coaching advice was spot on and the accuracy of my stats was surprising. It nailed the fastest lap time, the longest lap distance, and the number of laps.
customer_reviews.author: F. Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Love all the data that it collects.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps accurate track of my swim laps. It take a few seconds to register on the app when activated so I'm not sure that it connects at times. I thought it had a digital readout so I could know what lap I'm on but it doesn't. Still have to count the old fashioned way, in my head. Love all the data that it collects though. Amazing how it does that.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Swimming record
customer_reviews.text: The recording is very accurate. This is for children. It is used to record the swimming frequency. It also gives some suggestions. It is too professional.
customer_reviews.author: lisha

customer_reviews.title: Makes working out fun!
customer_reviews.text: I only wish it was cheaper and had more work out options for cardio like the eliptical. I really love this device though!!! Makes working out fun!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Great private trainer
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for two weeks . great trainer.i wear it for my swim. For mountain bike. For hiit. Simply great. Recently started wearing it whole day arround my ankle. First day had ""sleep" in my office till i learned to move my legs more often which is good.
customer_reviews.author: yair tzafri

customer_reviews.title: Moov Now - good tracking, but slimsy body
customer_reviews.text: I've used Moov Now for 1.5 year. Finally it is broken - there are some cracks on its cover - where you press to start syncro. I am fully satisfied with my swimming and training tracking info. However I absolutly dissapointed with its case quality - It is always a quest - if I pressed enough it to start syncronization? - you could only guess. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as swim tracker
customer_reviews.text: I use this just for tracking my swimming as my watch does not. I find it fantastic. Once i got used to how to do it up and how to use the associated app, brilliant. Shows laps, times, pauses, strokes. No probs! Takes a little long to synch but thats ok as swim times are usually at least 24 hours apart!
customer_reviews.author: PaulaNZ

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE BUT NOT JUST SIMPLE.
customer_reviews.text: It is so small and simple. However, the function is not so simple. I really enjoy this gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Eury Kim

customer_reviews.title: The app that was to "work" with the tablet didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The app that was to "work" with the tablet didn't stay synced and did not give me a workout read once. After 3 runs I gave up and sent back as it was a problem many people had
customer_reviews.author: Legates Mom

product_meta.title: 3D Fitness Tracker & Real Time Audio Coach, Moov Now:Swimming Running Water Resistant Activity Calories Tracker with Sleep Monitor, Bluetooth Smart Wristband for Android and iOS, Aqua Blue
feature_bullets: MOOV NOW provides real-time audio coaching for running, cycling, cardio boxing, body weight (Moov 7 Minute+)
Most advanced swim tracker - stroke type, stroke count, lap analysis, recommends ways to improve
A wearable fitness coach that speaks to you - actively monitors your motion, tracks your progress, and motivates you to achieve your fitness goals
Up to 6 months battery life and waterproof. Band is lightweight and breathable.Wear it on your wrist for swimming, on your ankle for running and cycling, or wear two for cardio boxing
Moov's Omni Motion sensor uses 3 times the sensors used in basic fitness trackers and provides real-time accuracy
Colorful and Insightful Data in your Moov App

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars1,606 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: 1 MOOV NOW Core, 1 Wrist Band, 1 Ankle Band, User guide, Battery tool, and a Free Extra Battery
